Purpose of calculated indicators
It is impossible to determine the necessary characteristics (financial, expert) of custom items of business processes without calculating the indicators.
Any indicator is a measure of the degree of achieving the goal (coefficient) or a set of quantitative parameters that reflect the organization performance.
In the System, these indicators are called
calculated indicators
.
Calculated indicators are developed and configured by analysts based on the stated requirements to the System. This enriches the information provided to the Customer by the necessary data.
In the System, the calculated indicator is implemented by the type "Calculation Module. Calculated indicator"
. We recommend that you create a custom indicator as its child. The calculated indicators created are stored in the corresponding registry (for more information, refer to
Working with the object registry
).
Calculation of such indicator is adjusted by the analyst via algorithms. For more information, refer to
Creating and configuring calculated indicators
.
